page.title: 03HOUSING IN WHALTON VILLAGE
page.content: The majority of houses in Whalton are grey sandstone and were built in the 19th.century. There is also a group of Council built houses originally intended for agricultural workers, several of which are now privately owned. These together with 6 old peoples' bungalows are grouped around an attractive grassed area. Very many of the older houses have been modernised but there are still several rented properties which do not even have indoor toilets. All the houses have mains water available. Mains drainage is available in the village but not to the outlying farms. One farm, Ogle Dean, has no mains electricity and relys on a generator. Even though a very large gas line was laid across our survey block recently, there is no gas available for domestic users.
